metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7548 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
SQLAlchemy 1.2.17 has SQL Injection when the group_by parameter can be controlled.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7548` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-sqlalchemy - 1.2.18+ds1-2ubuntu1
python-sqlalchemy-ext - 1.2.18+ds1-2ubuntu1
python3-sqlalchemy - 1.2.18+ds1-2ubuntu1
python3-sqlalchemy-ext - 1.2.18+ds1-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> since 1.0, sqlalchemy issues a warning when text() is omitted this fix for this issue turns the warning into an error since this change may break existing applications, it may not get fixed, marking priority as low

criterions.comment: sqlalchemy package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.18+ds1-2ubuntu1').
